subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help with MockObjects
msgSnippet: Hi Vincent, Oops. Looking through the JUnit code, I seem to have propagated another urban myth. That said, I always believed that the protocol says that
messageBody:
Hi Vincent,

Oops. Looking through the JUnit code, I seem to have propagated another
urban myth.

That said, I always believed that the protocol says that setUp() and
teardown() should be for administration of the test and that the
business of the test should be done within the test* methods. In the
jMock library, we have a VerifyingTestCase that overrides runBare() to
support this approach.

S.

Vincent Massol wrote:
> What's wrong with that? (happy to learn a new thing) :-)
>
> Steve mentioned in another email that the error do not get reported
> properly. Strange. It has always worked for me with either easymock or
> dynamocks.
>
> That it is now automatic in jmock is of course much better.
